t: Proverbs 12
Whoever*pn loves discipline loves knowledge, but*ln one who hates correction is stupid.
One*pn who is good obtains favor from the Lord,*s but*ln he condemns a person who schemes.
No*pn one can be made secure by wickedness, but*ln the root of the righteous is immovable.
A*pn wife of noble character is her husband’s crown, but*ln a wife who causes shame is*ln like rottenness in his bones.
The*pn thoughts of the righteous are just, but*ln guidance from the wicked is deceitful.
The*pn words of the wicked are a deadly ambush, but*ln the speech of the upright rescues them.
The*pn wicked are overthrown and perish, but*ln the house of the righteous will stand.
A*pn man is praised for his insight, but*ln a twisted mind is despised.
Better*pn to be disregarded, yet have a servant, than*ln to act important but have no food.
The*pn righteous cares about his animal’s health, but*ln even the merciful acts of the wicked are cruel.
The*pn one who works his land will have plenty of food, but*ln whoever chases fantasies lacks sense.
The*pn wicked desire what evil people have caught, but*ln the root of the righteous is productive.
By*pn rebellious speech an evil person is trapped, but*ln a righteous person escapes from trouble.
A*pn person will be satisfied with good by*ln the fruit of his mouth, and*ln the work of a person’s hands will reward him.
A*pn fool’s way is right in his own eyes, but*ln whoever listens to counsel is wise.
A*pn fool’s displeasure is known at once, but*ln whoever ignores an insult is sensible.
Whoever*pn speaks the truth declares what is right, but*ln a false witness speaks deceit.
There*pn is one who speaks rashly, like*ln a piercing sword; but*ln the tongue of the wise brings healing.
Truthful*pn lips endure forever, but*ln a lying tongue, only a moment.
Deceit*pn is in the hearts of those who plot evil, but*ln those who promote peace have joy.
No*pn disaster overcomes the righteous, but*ln the wicked are full of misery.
Lying*pn lips are detestable to the Lord,*s but*ln faithful people are his delight.
A*pn shrewd person conceals knowledge, but*ln a foolish heart publicizes stupidity.
The*pn diligent hand will rule, but*ln laziness will lead to forced labor.
Anxiety*pn in a person’s heart weighs it down, but*ln a good word cheers it up.
A*pn righteous person is careful in dealing with his neighbor, but*ln the ways of the wicked lead them astray.
A*pn lazy hunter doesn’t roast his game, but*ln to a diligent person, his wealth is precious.
There*pn is life in the path of righteousness, and*ln in its path there is no death.
